name: Whose Cult Is It Anyway?
description: Whose Cult Is It Anyway? explores themes of cults, followers, and charismatic leadership. Characters in this script often have abilities related to gathering followers, creating factions, or manipulating group dynamics.
author: Aero
specialRules: Focus on cult and leadership themes
Characters that create factions or followers
setupNotes: This script emphasizes cult-like dynamics and charismatic leadership. Players should be aware of how characters might create factions or influence group behavior.

winConditions.evil: Survive to equal the number of good players

howToRun: Cult dynamics and conversions. Make conversion rules explicit and limited. Track membership and voting impacts.

firstNight.description: Wake all Minions together. Show them who the other Minions are and who the Demon is
Wake the Demon. Show them who their Minions are. Give them 3 character tokens as bluffs

tipsAndTricks: Good: Guard key roles from conversion; verify loyalties often. Evil: Obscure membership and sow distrust about converts.
bluffing: Claim knowledge of cult effects to steer fear toward innocents.

modifiers.note: Godfather adds 1 Outsider and removes 1 Townsfolk.
Hell's Librarian provides special information access and record-keeping abilities.
Angel protects new players - something bad might happen to whoever is most responsible for their death.
Revolutionary creates 2 neighboring players of same alignment, with false registration once per game.
Fibbin allows 1 good player to get incorrect information once per game.
Duchess provides protection and special voting mechanics.
Sentinel may be used for game balance or specific scenarios.
Spirit of Ivory provides special mechanics related to information and deduction.
Djinn provides special wish-granting mechanics that can alter game state.
